Description: Stack form fields vertically in one column for maximum readability
Do: Use single-column layout — 27% faster completion than multi-column
Don't: Use side-by-side fields except for short paired inputs (city/state)
Code_Bad: <form class='grid grid-cols-2'> for unrelated fields
A11y_Note: Consistent tab order in single column

Description: Group related fields with visible fieldset and legend
Do: Use <fieldset> + <legend> to group related inputs logically
Don't: Put unrelated fields in same group — confusing
Code_Bad: All fields in flat list with no grouping
A11y_Note: Screen readers announce fieldset legend for context

Description: Show fields only when relevant based on previous answers
Do: Show additional fields based on prior selections
Don't: Show all 30 fields upfront — intimidating
Code_Bad: Show company field for personal accounts too
A11y_Note: Announce new fields via aria-live when revealed

Description: Place labels directly above their input field
Do: Label above input — highest usability and scannability
Don't: Floating labels that disappear on focus — users forget what field is
Code_Bad: <input placeholder='Email'> with no label
A11y_Note: Labels MUST be programmatically associated with inputs

Description: Mark required fields clearly — optional fields should say (optional)
Do: Mark optional fields with (optional) not required with asterisk
Don't: Mark required with * — users miss the tiny asterisk
Code_Bad: <label>Email*</label> — asterisk easily missed
A11y_Note: Use aria-required='true' for required fields

Description: Provide contextual help text below the field
Do: Place help text between label and input or below input
Don't: Use tooltip-only help — users miss it
Code_Bad: Help only in tooltip on hover — mobile can't hover
A11y_Note: Use aria-describedby to link help text to input

Description: Validate fields on blur — show success/error immediately
Do: Validate on blur (leaving field) — instant feedback
Don't: Validate only on submit — user fixes errors blindly
Code_Bad: Form validates only on submit — all errors at once
A11y_Note: Error messages must be adjacent to the field

Description: Show green checkmark on valid fields
Do: Show ✓ on valid fields — reduces anxiety
Don't: Only show errors — user unsure if input is accepted
Code_Bad: No feedback until error — user anxious
A11y_Note: Announce valid state: 'Email is valid'

Description: Clear specific error message near the field
Do: Show specific actionable error: 'Email must include @'
Don't: Show generic 'Invalid' — user guesses what's wrong
Code_Bad: Invalid input
A11y_Note: Use role='alert' for error announcements

Description: Delay validation to avoid premature errors while typing
Do: Debounce 300-500ms to validate after user stops typing
Don't: Validate on every keystroke — shows error on first character
Code_Good: let timer; input.oninput = () => { clearTimeout(timer); timer = setTimeout(validate, 400) }
Code_Bad: input.oninput = validate — error after typing 'j' for email
A11y_Note: Don't announce errors during active typing

Description: Real-time password strength meter with requirements list
Do: Show checklist of requirements that check off as met
Don't: Single 'Password too weak' message — user guesses requirements
Code_Bad: Password too weak
A11y_Note: Announce requirement changes to screen readers

Description: Use type='email' for email fields with appropriate autocomplete
Do: Use type='email' + autocomplete='email' for mobile keyboard
Don't: Use type='text' for email — no @ keyboard on mobile
Code_Bad: <input type='text' name='email'>
A11y_Note: Mobile keyboards show @ button for type='email'

Description: Use type='tel' with appropriate formatting and country code
Do: Use type='tel' + inputmode='tel' for numeric keyboard
Don't: Use type='text' for phone — no numeric keyboard
Code_Bad: <input type='text' placeholder='Phone'>
A11y_Note: Numeric keyboard on mobile for tel type

Description: Use native date picker or accessible custom date picker
Do: Use <input type='date'> for simple dates or accessible library for ranges
Don't: Build custom date dropdowns (3 selects for month/day/year)
Code_Bad: <select>Month</select><select>Day</select><select>Year</select>
A11y_Note: Native date inputs are accessible by default

Description: Use type='search' with clear button and keyboard shortcut
Do: Use type='search' + role='search' on container + Ctrl+K shortcut
Don't: Use type='text' for search — no clear button on mobile
Code_Bad: <input type='text' class='search-input'>
A11y_Note: Use role='search' landmark for screen readers

Description: Show which step user is on and how many remain
Do: Show step dots/bar with current step highlighted and labels
Don't: No progress indicator — user doesn't know how many steps remain
Code_Good: Step 2 of 4: [✓ Info] [● Address] [○ Payment] [○ Review]
Code_Bad: Multi-step form with no step indicator
A11y_Note: Announce current step to screen readers

Description: Validate each step before allowing progression
Do: Block 'Next' until current step validates — show inline errors
Don't: Allow skipping steps with required empty fields
Code_Good: Next button disabled until step validates + clear errors
Code_Bad: Next button always enabled — errors pile up at end
A11y_Note: Focus first error field when validation fails

Description: Allow going back to previous steps without losing data
Do: Preserve all entered data when navigating back
Don't: Clear fields when going back — user rage
Code_Good: Save step data to state before navigating; restore on return
Code_Bad: Going back clears the current step's data
A11y_Note: Announce step change to screen readers

Description: Auto-save form progress to prevent data loss
Do: Auto-save to localStorage every 30 seconds with visual indicator
Don't: Lose all data on page refresh or browser crash
Code_Bad: No auto-save — user loses 10 minutes of work on crash
A11y_Note: Show 'Draft saved' status for reassurance

Description: Disable submit button during processing with loading indicator
Do: Show loading spinner in button + disable during submit
Don't: Allow multiple clicks — duplicate submissions
Code_Bad: <button>Submit</button> clickable during processing
A11y_Note: Add aria-busy='true' during processing

Description: Show clear success message after successful submission
Do: Show success message + next steps + what happens now
Don't: Redirect silently with no confirmation
Code_Good: Toast: '✅ Account created! Check your email to verify.'
Code_Bad: Redirect to home with no confirmation
A11y_Note: Announce success via role='status'

Description: Show server errors clearly with retry option
Do: Show specific error near relevant field + retry button
Don't: Show generic 'Something went wrong' modal
Code_Good: Server error next to field: 'Email already registered. [Login instead?]'
Code_Bad: 'Error occurred. Please try again later.'
A11y_Note: Focus first error field after server error

Description: Use correct autocomplete values for browser autofill
Do: Set autocomplete attribute on every field for browser autofill
Don't: Omit autocomplete — user must type everything manually
Code_Bad: <input name='field1'> with no autocomplete hint
A11y_Note: Autofill reduces cognitive load for all users

Description: Use Places API or similar for address prediction
Do: Integrate address autocomplete to reduce typing errors
Don't: Make user type full address manually — error-prone
Code_Good: Google Places Autocomplete on address field
Code_Bad: Manual: street + city + state + zip with no autocomplete
A11y_Note: Ensure autocomplete dropdown is keyboard navigable

Description: Support drag-and-drop file upload with click fallback
Do: Support drag-drop + click + paste for maximum flexibility
Don't: Only <input type='file'> button — no drag-drop
Code_Good: Drop zone with dashed border + 'Drag files here or click to browse'
Code_Bad: <input type='file'> hidden behind ugly button
A11y_Note: Announce file selected/uploaded to screen readers

Description: Show uploaded file preview before submission
Do: Show thumbnail preview + filename + size + remove button
Don't: No preview — user unsure which files are queued
Code_Good: Image thumbnail grid with [×] remove on each
Code_Bad: File name only in a list with no preview
A11y_Note: Alt text for preview: 'Uploaded: vacation.jpg 2.3MB'

Description: Show upload progress for large files
Do: Per-file progress bar with percentage and cancel option
Don't: No progress for large uploads — user thinks it froze
Code_Bad: Spinner only during 50MB upload — no progress
A11y_Note: Announce upload progress at milestones (25/50/75/100%)

Description: Edit values in place without navigating to separate form
Do: Click to edit with save/cancel actions inline
Don't: Navigate to separate page for every edit
Code_Bad: Click 'Edit Profile' → full page form for one field change
A11y_Note: Announce edit mode activation to screen readers

Description: Pre-fill fields with intelligent defaults based on context
Do: Pre-fill country from IP and format from locale
Don't: Leave all fields empty when you have context data
Code_Good: Default: country from navigator.language; date format from Intl
Code_Bad: Empty country dropdown with 200+ options — no default
A11y_Note: Announce pre-filled values so user can verify

Description: Format input as user types (phone/credit card/date)
Do: Apply mask progressively: (555) 123-4567 as user types
Don't: Enforce strict format upfront — rejects valid input
Code_Good: Cleave.js or Intl masking: auto-format on input
Code_Bad: Reject '5551234567' because no dashes — user frustration
A11y_Note: Announce formatted value to screen readers

Description: Include CSRF token in all form submissions
Do: Include hidden CSRF token in every form
Don't: Submit forms without CSRF protection
Code_Bad: No CSRF token — vulnerable to cross-site request forgery
A11y_Note: No a11y impact — security measure

Description: Sanitize all user input on server side
Do: Sanitize HTML/SQL on server before storage and display
Don't: Trust client-side validation alone — bypassable
Code_Bad: Direct user input into SQL query — injection risk
A11y_Note: No a11y impact — security measure

Description: Limit form submission frequency to prevent abuse
Do: Rate limit submissions: max 5 per minute per IP
Don't: No rate limiting — bots spam submissions
Code_Good: 429 response after 5 attempts + 'Try again in 60 seconds'
Code_Bad: Unlimited submissions — server overwhelmed by bots
A11y_Note: Show clear message when rate limited

Description: Ensure form fields are touch-friendly on mobile
Do: Min 44px input height + adequate spacing between fields
Don't: Small inputs + tiny tap targets on mobile
Code_Bad: <input class='h-8 text-xs'> on mobile — impossible to tap
A11y_Note: 44px minimum touch target per WCAG

Description: Show appropriate mobile keyboard for each input type
Do: Use inputmode attribute for optimal mobile keyboard
Don't: Use type='text' for everything — wrong keyboard
Code_Bad: <input type='text'> for numeric-only field
A11y_Note: Correct keyboard reduces input errors
